subject: Re: Test genes, test infected rates, and test-resistant managers
msgSnippet: ... use ... for ... same ... Have you seen Jeff Langr s /Agile Java/ book? http://www.bookpool.com/sm/0131482394 Regards, Jim
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jeremy D. Frens" <jdfrens@...> wrote:
>
> To my knowledge, no Java or C++ introductory textbooks describe or
use
> JUnit. There are some excellent books on JUnit and TDD, but they're
> written for reasonably experienced programmers. We need materials
for
> the beginning programmer. My CS 1 lab manual (which uses JUnit
> everywhere, all the time) is currently just for private use; I am
> planning to get it published somehow, somewhere. I hope to do the
same
> to my PL materials.
>

Have you seen Jeff Langr's /Agile Java/ book?
http://www.bookpool.com/sm/0131482394

Regards,
Jim
